snippet: Only 8 percent of the city’s taxi and for-hire drivers were born in the United States, a shift that has had a profound effect on the industry.
abstract: American-born New York City cabby, long a stalwart of industry even as immigrants began to dominate its ranks, has now just about vanished; Taxi and Limousine Commission reports that today, only 8 percent of New York City taxi and for-hire drivers were born in the United States; shift to a near-uniform immigrant work force has had a profound effect on taxi industry, reshaping relationship between driver and passenger.
lead_paragraph: Only 8 percent of the city’s taxi and for-hire drivers were born in the United States, a shift that has had a profound effect on the industry.

headline.main: American-Born Cabbies Are a Vanishing Breed in New York
headline.print_headline: American-Born Cabbies Are Vanishing Breed in City
